sources.title: 1989 Essen 223 (Community film)
sources.description: Filmklasse Münster, Community film Each participant received a local transport week-ticket for the cinematic exploration of the Ruhr Area / Germany with the results: Dortmund Hoesch by Julian Poensgen Gelsenkirchen-Rotthausen by Hubertus Müll Bochum by Bernhard Wallasch Essen- Margarethenhöhe by Hubertus Müll Essen-Steele and Wanne-Eickel by André M. Kuhl Herten-Langenbochunm by Hubertus Müll Mühlheim, Dortmund-Dorstfeld, Essen, Essen-Altenessen, Duisburg Hbf by Joern Hintzer With: Katja Butt, Jeorn Hintzer, Andreas Köpnick, André M. Kuhl, Hubertus Müll, Julian Poensgen, Josua Vogelbusch, Susanne Weydert and Bernhard Wallasch The Art Academy Münster / Germany is a University of Fine Arts. In terms of liberal arts here artists and art educators are studying in joint classes in the fields of painting, sculpture, installation art, performance, photography, film and new media. Besides history, criticism, theory and didactics of art form the scientific priorities. The principle of the studio studying under the direction of each artist professor goes back to the artistic education at the classical art academies and is fundamentally different from rate regimes as they were introduced about in Anglo-Saxon countries. Founded in 1971 as the Institute of Art Educator as part of the Art Academy Dusseldorf, the Art Academy Münster in 1987 became independent. Since 2001, all areas of the Art Academy Münster are gathered together with a separate library in a new building, which was designed specifically for its purposes. Over the past 25 years, the Art Academy Münster developed to a place with an international reputation. The Filmklasse was founded by Lutz Mommartz and since then always had a special role inside the Art Academy Münster reflecting about new media, far more than only film.
